definition: fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
foreign (non-Chinese)/barbarian/classifier for occurrences (of an event, action or speech utterance)/classifier for iterations: times, -fold (as in twofold etc)/classifier for situations: kind, sort

sentences.english: and offer it on the altar, together with the grain offering, and make atonement for him, and he will be clean.
sentences.chinese: 把燔祭和素祭献在坛上为他赎罪，他就洁净了。

sentences.english: Lebanon is not sufficient for altar fires, nor its animals enough for burnt offerings.
sentences.chinese: 利巴嫩的树林不彀当柴烧，其中的走兽也不彀作燔祭。

sentences.english: And Lebanon is not sufficient to burn, nor the beasts thereof sufficient for a burnt offering.
sentences.chinese: 黎巴嫩的树林不够当柴烧，其中的走兽也不够作燔祭。

sentences.english: Remember all thy offerings, and accept thy burnt sacrifice; Selah.
sentences.chinese: 记念你的一切供献，悦纳你的燔祭。

sentences.english: And he shall put his hand upon the head of the burnt offering； and it shall be accepted for him to make atonement for him.
sentences.chinese: 他要按手在燔祭牲的头上，燔祭便蒙悦纳，为他赎罪。

sentences.english: And he shall put his hand upon the head of the burnt offering； and it shall be accepted for him to make atonement for him.
sentences.chinese: 他要按手在燔祭牲的头上，燔祭便蒙悦纳，为他赎罪。

sentences.english: So they went in to make sacrifices and burnt offerings.
sentences.chinese: 耶户和约拿达进去，献平安祭和燔祭。

sentences.english: He is to slaughter the lamb in the holy place where the sin offering and the burnt offering are slaughtered.
sentences.chinese: 把公羊羔宰于圣地，就是宰赎罪祭牲和燔祭牲之地。

sentences.english: He washed the inner parts and the legs and burned them on top of the burnt offering on the altar.
sentences.chinese: 又洗了脏腑和腿，烧在坛上的燔祭上。

sentences.english: He is to lay his hand on the head of the burnt offering, and it will be accepted on his behalf to make atonement for him.
sentences.chinese: 他要按手在燔祭牲的头上，燔祭便蒙悦纳，为他赎罪。

sentences.english: He is to lay his hand on the head of the burnt offering, and it will be accepted on his behalf to make atonement for him.
sentences.chinese: 他要按手在燔祭牲的头上，燔祭便蒙悦纳，为他赎罪。

sentences.english: I will offer unto thee burnt sacrifices of fatlings, with the incense of rams; I will offer bullocks with goats.
sentences.chinese: 我要把肥牛作燔祭，将公羊的香祭献给你。

sentences.english: " Then rural festival "Burnt meat is not to.
God will himself provide a lamb for a burnt-offering.
sentences.chinese: 上帝自己会提供燔祭用的羔羊的。

sentences.english: From the first day of the seventh month began they to offer burnt offerings unto the LORD.
sentences.chinese: 从七月初一日起，他们就向耶和华献燔祭。

sentences.english: As long as Jehoiada lived, burnt offerings were presented continually in the temple of the Lord .
sentences.chinese: 耶何耶大在世的时候，众人常在耶和华殿里献燔祭。

definition: multitudinous/the masses/to present (to sb)/to rise/to advance/to progress/archaic variant of 蒸[zheng1]
variant of 閹|阉[yan1]/to castrate/variant of 淹[yan1]/to delay
